DOC.brief_title: Autologous Cord Blood Cell Therapy Neonatal Encephalopathy
DOC.detailed_description: This multicenter pilot study evaluate feasibility safety intravenous infusion autologous ( patient 's ) umbilical cord blood cell term gestation newborn neonatal encephalopathy ( hypoxic-ischemic encephalopathy ) . If neonate bear sign moderate severe encephalopathy cool encephalopathy , neonate receive non-cryopreserved volume- red blood cell-reduced cord blood cell . The cord blood cell divide 3 dos infused 12-24 , 36-48 , 60-72 hour birth . Infants follow safety neurodevelopmental outcome 18 month .
DOC.criteria: Infants eligible meet follow inclusion criterion except 4 . 1 . ≥36 week gestation 2 . Either 10minute Apgar score ≤5 , continue need resuscitation least 10 minute , severe acidosis , define pH < 7.0 base deficit ≥16 mmol/L sample umbilical cord blood blood first hour birth 3 . Moderate severe encephalopathy ( Sarnat II III ) 4 . A moderately severely abnormal background amplitudeintegrated EEG ( aEEG ) voltage , seizure identify aEEG , monitor 5 . Up 24 hour age 6 . Autologous umbilical cord blood available infuse within 3 day birth 7 . A person parental authority must consent study . 1 . Known major congenital anomaly , chromosomal anomaly , heart diseases 2 . Major intracranial hemorrhage identify brain ultrasonography compute tomography 3 . Severe growth restriction , birthweight less 1800 g 4 . Severe infectious disease , sepsis 5 . Hyperkalemia 6 . Outborn infant ( Infants bear hospital study site ) 7 . Volume collect cord blood < 40 ml 8 . Infants judge critically ill unlikely benefit neonatal intensive care attend neonatologist
